intro: Cacalia subsessilis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, linear leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a composite head, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Cacalia subsessilis is an annual herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its native range.
